person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Australia bade farewell to David Campese in spectacular fashion by overwhelming the Barbarians 39-12 in the final match of their European tour at Twickenham on Saturday .

Let's think step by step.

| Person |
|--------|
| David Campese |

In this paragraph, "David Campese" is the only clearly identifiable person mentioned.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Person" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Person |
|--------|
| David Campese |

In this paragraph, only "David Campese" is mentioned as a person. Other entities such as "Australia", "Barbarians", and "Twickenham" do not refer to people.

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Australia bade farewell to David Campese in spectacular fashion by overwhelming the Barbarians 39-12 in the final match of their European tour at Twickenham on Saturday .

Let's think step by step.

| Organization |
| --- |
| Australia |
| Barbarians |
| Twickenham |

In this paragraph, "Australia" refers to the Australian national rugby union team, "Barbarians" refers to the Barbarian Football Club, and "Twickenham" refers to Twickenham Stadium, the venue where the match took place.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Organization" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Organization |
| --- |
| Australia (Australian national rugby union team) |
| Barbarian Football Club (Barbarians) |
| Twickenham Stadium |

In this revised version, I have clarified that "Australia" refers to the Australian national rugby union team to make it clear that it is an organization. The term "bade farewell" does not refer to an organization, but rather the action taken by Australia towards David Campese. Similarly, "overwhelming the Barbarians" and "final match of their European tour" describe the outcome of a rugby union match between two organizations, so "Barbarians" and "their European tour" are also valid entities. "Twickenham" remains a valid organization as it is a stadium.
